channel.title: FTP connection (with and without VPN after Tor)
channel.description:
I use ftp (the CLI) to connect to my site.
With Tor before VPN, after the authorization, I type >ftp>passive
and then I can successfully run any ftp command: ls, dir, get, put etc.
When I try that with a standard Whonix-Workstation, running any command after passive fails. It displays the following and halts
>227 Entering Passive Mode
And if I don't use passive:
>230 OK. Current restricted directory is / Remote system type is UNIX. Using binary mode to transfer files. ftp> ls 500 I won't open a connection to 10.152.152.11 (only to [ --redacted-- ]) ftp: bind: Address already in use
Save deal with FileZilla - connection is established (either with plain FTP or with an Explicit FTP over TLS), but fails with >|Command:|MLSD| >|---|---| >|Error:|Connection timed out| >|Error:|Failed to retrieve directory listing|

item.title: FTP connection (with and without VPN after Tor)

item.description:
FTP seems tricky because the way it works and also the limits of how you can connect over Tor see:

reddit

r/TOR - FTP over Tor?

3 votes and 6 comments so far on Reddit

The results of trying to use it are described above.

item.source: FTP connection (with and without VPN after Tor)

item.title: FTP connection (with and without VPN after Tor)
item.dc:creator: Henry
item.description:
I use ftp (the CLI) to connect to my site.

With Tor before VPN, after the authorization, I type

ftp>passive

and then I can successfully run any ftp command: ls, dir, get, put etc.

When I try that with a standard Whonix-Workstation, running any command after passive fails. It displays the following and halts

227 Entering Passive Mode

And if I don’t use passive:

230 OK. Current restricted directory is /
Remote system type is UNIX.
Using binary mode to transfer files.
ftp> ls
500 I won’t open a connection to 10.152.152.11 (only to [ --redacted-- ])
ftp: bind: Address already in use

Save deal with FileZilla - connection is established (either with plain FTP or with an Explicit FTP over TLS), but fails with

Command: MLSD
Error: Connection timed out
Error: Failed to retrieve directory listing

Read full topic
item.source: FTP connection (with and without VPN after Tor)
